alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Refugio; Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 31 at 7:40PM CST until January 31 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south Texas, including the following counties, Calhoun, Refugio and Victoria. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 740 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port Lavaca, Seadrift, McFaddin, Port Oconnor, Long Mott, Green Lake, Alamo Beach, Magnolia Beach and Indianola. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
